author: Jordan Shafer
comment: Good functionality on watch, but the app icon on the phone is a complete waste of space, since it is unneeded. Opening the app on the phone literally says that it is unneeded.  To the developer: if you look at other wear-only apps like Slumber, there is no app icon on the phone. Regarding uninstalling, you can go into your main application list to uninstall (from settings) or directly uninstall from Google Play. Maybe an option to hide the app icon would satisfy everyone.

reply.author: AllAboutEE
reply.content: It's necessary for installing the Wear app, also how else would you uninstall it if you don't like it? If this is your only complaint please consider changing the rating you gave it, once the rating falls below 3 I stop updating an app since the effort is not worth the reward, and the app has no ads either. Thanks.

title: Get rid of app icon on phone app drawer

author: Max Kutsman
comment: First running android app that does not require a phone. Would be better if also reported calories burned based on weight.
title: Good

author: Justin Guiao
comment: Seems to work well, but in the description you mention that you should set your step length for calibration. The app seems to have no settings, how would I set this on my Moto 360?

author: Scott Alexander-Bown
comment: Would be more useful the mph.  I would pay for that. Also would love Google fit integration.
title: Pace in minutes per mile / km

author: Stephen Murphy
comment: Exactly what I wanted, now if you put the start and stop on the one screen, make it look like a sporty watch face, maybe with split times , I would buy that
title: Awesome

author: me me
comment: Great app.  I would buy the Pro version if it uploaded information to Google Fit.
title: Great App

comment: Great app for me I love it.
title: Run forest Run
